===Egyptian records set in 2010===
===Egyptian records set in 2010===
â
On 31 January 2010, [[Egypt national football team|Egypt]] set a new African record, not being defeated for 19 consecutive Cup of Nations matches, since a 2-1 loss against [[Algeria national football team|Algeria]] in [[2004 African Cup of Nations|Tunisia in 2004]], and a record 9 consecutive win streak. Egypt also set another record on that day, where it became the first African Cup nation to win three consecutive cups.
+
On 31 January 2010, [[Egypt national football team|Egypt]] set a new African record, not being defeated for 19 consecutive Cup of Nations matches, since a 2-1 loss against [[Algeria national football team|Algeria]] in [[2004 African Cup of Nations|Tunisia in 2004]], and a record 9 consecutive win streak. Egypt also set another record on that day, where it became the first African Cup nation to win three consecutive cups joining [[Mexico national football team|Mexico]], [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]], and [[Iran national football team|Iran]] who won their [[continent]] cup 3 times in a row.
